revision.text:
This is a list of the default [[Classes|classes]] available in Strife. For classes from other games, see the [[Classes|main article]]. ==Monsters== ===The Order=== {{Class|Acolyte}} // Standard trooper enemy {{Class|AcolyteTan}} // Standard trooper enemy {{Class|AcolyteRed}} // Low-rank officer enemy in red uniform {{Class|AcolyteRust}} // Guard enemy in brown uniform {{Class|AcolyteGray}} // Low-rank officer enemy in dark grey uniform {{Class|AcolyteDGreen}} // Sewer guard enemy in dark green uniform that drops the guard uniform item {{Class|AcolyteGold}} // Elite guard enemy in gold uniform {{Class|AcolyteLGreen}} // Overseer enemy in bright green uniform {{Class|AcolyteBlue}} // Scanner trooper enemy in teal uniform {{Class|AcolyteShadow}} // Standard trooper enemy with a cloaking device {{Class|AcolyteToBe}} // An incomplete acolyte that does nothing when attacked, gibs when killed, talks like a peasant ===The Resistance=== {{Class|Macil1}} // The leader of the Front, Macil, found in Map03, invulnerable {{Class|Macil2}} // The leader of the Front, Macil, acts like a spectre but requires Sigil2 or stronger to take damage {{Class|Rebel}} // Standard Front soldier (Can not be talked to, Summoned by beacon) {{Class|Rebel1}} // Standard Front soldier {{Class|Rebel2}} // Standard Front soldier that Guards Irale's Shop {{Class|Rebel3}} // Standard Front soldier {{Class|Rebel4}} // Standard Front soldier {{Class|Rebel5}} // Standard Front soldier {{Class|Rebel6}} // Standard Front soldier {{Class|RatBuddy}} // A rat that is invulnerable, not a monster ===The Oppressed=== {{Class|Beggar}} // Beggar that can not be talked to {{Class|Beggar1}} // MacGuffin {{Class|Beggar2}} // Underground beggar {{Class|Beggar3}} // Underground beggar {{Class|Beggar4}} // Underground beggar {{Class|Beggar5}} // Underground beggar {{Class|Merchant}} // Weapons merchant that can not be talked to {{Class|WeaponSmith}} // Weapons merchant from Map 02 {{Class|BarKeep}} // The tavern bartender from Map 02 {{Class|Armorer}} // Armor merchant from Map 02 {{Class|Medic}} // Hospital medic from Map 02 {{Class|Peasant}} // Beige peasant that can not be talked to {{Class|Peasant1}} // Tan-colored peasant {{Class|Peasant2}} // Arion, the Governor's secretary {{Class|Peasant3}} // Ulaine, the info guy {{Class|Peasant4}} // Harris (Map 2 & 23), Tevick (Map 23) {{Class|Peasant5}} // Derwin (Map 4), Harris (Map 33) {{Class|Peasant6}} // Worner (Map 4) {{Class|Peasant7}} // Ketrick (Map 4), Warden (Map 5), Medic (Map 17) {{Class|Peasant8}} // Sammis (Map 4), Judge (map 5) {{Class|Peasant9}} // Beldin (Map 1) {{Class|Peasant10}} // Rowan (Map 2) {{Class|Peasant11}} // Geoff (Map 2) {{Class|Peasant12}} // Technician (Map 4) {{Class|Peasant13}} // Irale (Map 2), Richter (Map 23) {{Class|Peasant14}} // Weran, the Rat King (Map 6) {{Class|Peasant15}} // Computer Technician (Map 4) {{Class|Peasant16}} // Sewer Overflow Gate guard (Map 1), false Programmer (Map 7) {{Class|Peasant17}} // Light Green peasant {{Class|Peasant18}} // Light Green peasant {{Class|Peasant19}} // Key Master (Map 11), false Programmer (Map 31) {{Class|Peasant20}} // Gold peasant {{Class|Peasant21}} // Gold peasant {{Class|Peasant22}} // Governor Mourel (Map 2 & 33), false Programmer (Map 8) ===The Antagonists=== {{Class|AlienSpectre1}} // Translucent, floating blob that can only be killed with the Sigil, fires Sigil1 blasts {{Class|AlienSpectre2}} // fires Sigil2 blasts {{Class|AlienSpectre3}} // fires Sigil3 blasts {{Class|AlienSpectre4}} // fires Sigil4 blasts {{Class|AlienSpectre5}} // fires Sigil5 blasts {{Class|AlienChunkSmall}} // Spectre Gibs {{Class|AlienChunkLarge}} // More spectre gibs {{Class|EntityBoss}} // Super spectre, uses all 5 sigils and breaks into: {{Class|EntitySecond}} // on death. When all these are gone, level ends. {{Class|EntityNest}} // Entity Nest decoration {{Class|EntityPod}} // Spawns Super Spectre {{Class|Loremaster}} // Flies around, uses grappler {{Class|Oracle}} // Some sort of puppet that talks {{Class|Programmer}} // Uses an anti grav platform, rains Sigil 1 lightning {{Class|ProgrammerBase}} // Gibs from the above {{Class|ProgLevelEnder}} // Fades to black smoothly and ends the level {{Class|StrifeBishop}} // Tall, cybernetic boss with a rocket launcher that has a homing ability {{Class|KneelingGuy}} // Holographic projection of a minion, device is tall enough to block movement but short enough to jump over ===The Machines=== {{Class|Sentinel}} // Small floating Robot, fires lasers {{Class|Crusader}} // Large, lumbering assault robot. Resembles Ed 209 {{Class|Inquisitor}} // Towering mech, flies, throws nasty grenades {{Class|InquisitorArm}} // Junk from the above when it explodes {{Class|Stalker}} // Small, spider like robot, crawls along the ceiling and drops on your head {{Class|CeilingTurret}} // Defensive turret, minor threat {{Class|Templar}} // A human supported by a mechanical bio-suit. Fires mauler. {{Class|Reaver}} // Nasty, quick robot that uses a shotgun and rips you up in melee ==Explosives== {{Class|FastFlameMissile}} // Flamethrower effect used by Crusader and Flamethrower weapon {{Class|CrusaderMissile}} // Missile effect used by Crusader, this is a tri-missile pyramid attack {{Class|InquisitorShot}} // Explosive grenade attack from Inquisitor {{Class|LoreShot}} // A grappling hook. Thrusts target in the opposite direction that it moves {{Class|LoreShot2}} // Grappling hook chain link {{Class|SentinelFX1}} // Sentinel firing animation - does no damage {{Class|SentinelFX2}} // Sentinel firing animation and sound FX, does damage/disintegration {{Class|SpectralLightningBase}} // {{Class|SpectralLightningDeath1}} // {{Class|SpectralLightningDeath2}} // {{Class|SpectralLightningDeathShort}} // {{Class|SpectralLightningBall1}} // Sigil3 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningBall2}} // Sigil3 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningH1}} // Sigil2 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningH2}} // Sigil2 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningH3}} // Sigil2 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningHTail}} // Sigil2 tail animation, does no damage {{Class|SpectralLightningBigBall1}} // Sigil5 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningBigBall2}} // Sigil5 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningV1}} // Sigil4 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningV2}} // Sigil4 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningSpot}} // Sigil1 firing animation {{Class|SpectralLightningBigV1}} // Sigil4 firing animation, used by AlienSpectre4 {{Class|SpectralLightningBigV2}} // Sigil4 firing animation, used by AlienSpectre4 {{Class|BishopMissile}} // Bishop Missile firing animation, has homing ability {{Class|StrifeZap1}} // Effect of electric bolt when it hits an object {{Class|ElectricBolt}} // Fires an Electric Bolt that does extra damage to mechanical enemies {{Class|PoisonBolt}} // Fires a poison bolt that instantly kills human targets, ineffective against everything else {{Class|RocketTrail}} // Rocket trail animation for the mini missile {{Class|MiniMissilePuff}} // Smoke puff animation for the mini missile {{Class|MiniMissile}} // Fires a missile {{Class|FlameMissile}} // Fires a flamethrower projectile {{Class|MaulerPuff}} // Animation of Mauler primary mode fire {{Class|MaulerTorpedo}} // Animation of Mauler alternate mode fire {{Class|MaulerTorpedoWave}} // Animation of Mauler alternate mode fire after hitting its initial target {{Class|HEGrenade}} // Fires a HE Grenade {{Class|PhosphorousGrenade}} // Fires a Phosphorous Grenade {{Class|PhosphorousFire}} // Summons the fire that is produced by the Phosphorous Grenade {{Class|StrifePuff}} // Smoke puff animation of a barrel when hit {{Class|StrifeSpark}} // Spark animation of a barrel when hit ==Pickups== ===Weapons=== {{Class|PunchDagger}} // Melee weapon, silent killer, damage affected by UpgradeStamina {{Class|StrifeCrossbow}} // Fires electric bolts that are effective vs machines {{Class|StrifeCrossbow2}} // Fires poison bolts - instant kill, and silent. {{Class|AssaultGun}} // Rapid fire hitscan weapon, fairly inaccurate(until powered up with UpgradeAccuracy),
// fires 3 bullets at a time {{Class|AssaultGunStanding}} // Alternate pickup graphic of the above. {{Class|MiniMissileLauncher}} // Fires small, explosive missiles rapidly. {{Class|FlameThrower}} // Short range flame, lots of kickback, human targets burn on death {{Class|Mauler}} // Equivalent to the super shotgun, disintegrates human targets {{Class|Mauler2}} // Fires a torpedo, initial target takes massive damage including splash, explodes into smaller projectiles
// doing smaller damage, disintegrates human targets. Firing it damages player by 20 health affected by armor. {{Class|StrifeGrenadeLauncher}} // Double barreled grenade launcher. Massive damage {{Class|StrifeGrenadeLauncher2}} // Even more damaging, grenades explode into flames that burn for quite a while. {{Class|Sigil}} // The Sigil. Gives you Sigil1. {{Class|Sigil1}} // Creates an area affect of lightning rain that wanders around {{Class|Sigil2}} // Fires a small bolt straight ahead which creates a trail of lightning, has splash damage {{Class|Sigil3}} // Fires a 180 arc of lightning blobs, has splash damage {{Class|Sigil4}} // Fires a single vertical lightning column, that homes in on targeted actor,
// works like Revenants's homing missile {{Class|Sigil5}} // Fires a lightning blob which in turn continuously fires lightning bolts
// ahead and to either side of it. ===Ammo=== {{Class|HEGrenadeRounds}} // HE Grenade Ammo, gives 6 {{Class|PhosphorusGrenadeRounds}} // Phosphorus Grenade Ammo, gives 4 {{Class|ClipOfBullets}} // Bullet ammo, gives 10 {{Class|BoxOfBullets}} // More bullet ammo, gives 50 {{Class|MiniMissiles}} // Mini Missile ammo, gives 4 {{Class|CrateOfMissiles}} // More missile ammo, gives 20 {{Class|EnergyPod}} // Cell ammo, gives 20 {{Class|EnergyPack}} // More cell ammo, gives 100 {{Class|PoisonBolts}} // Poison bolts, gives 10 {{Class|ElectricBolts}} // Eletric bolts, gives 20 {{Class|AmmoSatchel}} // Strife Backpack equivalent, gives 2 electric bolts, 4 poison bolts,
// 6 HE grenades, 4 Phosphorus grenades, 10 bullets, 20 cells ===Inventory=== {{Class|Coin}} // 1 Gold coin {{Class|Gold10}} // 10 Gold coins {{Class|Gold25}} // 25 Gold coins {{Class|Gold50}} // 50 Gold coins {{Class|Gold300}} // 300 Gold coins, used in conjunction with completing quest {{Class|MetalArmor}} // Metal Armor, 200 armor {{Class|LeatherArmor}} // Leather Armor, 100 armor {{Class|TeleporterBeacon}} // Telporter Beacon, summons 6 rebel soldiers, can be picked up again if no rebel soldier spawned {{Class|MedPatch}} // Med Patch, +10 health {{Class|MedicalKit}} // Medical Kit, +25 health {{Class|SurgeryKit}} // Surgery Kit, full health, as high as base health (100) + current Stamina rating {{Class|StrifeMap}} // Strife automap {{Class|ShadowArmor}} // Shadow armor, Strife equivalent of partial invisibility {{Class|EnvironmentalSuit}} // Environmental suit, protection against poison, immunity to flamethrower {{Class|Targeter}} // Targeter, accuracy meter {{Class|Scanner}} // Scanner, works like Doom iddt code (automap+object locations) {{Class|AmmoFillup}} // Gives up to 50 bullets, works in conjunction with Feris {{Class|HealthFillup}} // Gives up to predefined life based on difficulty, works in conjunction with Gerard {{Class|UpgradeStamina}} // Gives player 10 extra recoverable health units (up to 200), heal like SurgeryKit, increases damage {{Class|UpgradeAccuracy}} // Improves the player's accuracy by 10 accuracy units when firing Strife weapons
// except for Sigil (all versions) ===Quest=== {{Class|Communicator}} // Communicator, allows Blackbird to talk to you throughout the game. {{Class|FlameThrowerParts}} // An item dropped by a crusader that allows the building of a flamethrower in the weapon shop. {{Class|QuestItem}} // Base class for quest items used to implement {{dw|Strife quest flags}}. {{Class|QuestItem1}} // Given with Beldin's ring {{Class|QuestItem2}} // Given with the chalice {{Class|QuestItem3}} // Given by {{Class|Macil1}} during his first conversation {{Class|QuestItem4}} // Given when taking Mourel's "messy" job {{Class|QuestItem5}} // Given when taking Mourel's "bloody" job {{Class|QuestItem6}} // Given when destroying the power coupling {{Class|QuestItem7}} // Given when the last of the blue acolytes in a map die {{Class|QuestItem8}} // Given with the broken power coupling {{Class|QuestItem9}} // Given with Derwin's ear {{Class|QuestItem10}} // Given with Mourel's prison pass {{Class|QuestItem11}} // Given with Montag's prison key {{Class|QuestItem12}} // Given with Wolenick's severed hand {{Class|QuestItem13}} // Given when freeing the prisoners {{Class|QuestItem14}} // You blew up the crystal {{Class|QuestItem15}} // Given with guard uniform {{Class|QuestItem16}} // You blew up the gates {{Class|QuestItem17}} // Given when listening to Macil's story about the Sigil {{Class|QuestItem18}} // Talked to the Oracle, corresponds with getting the Oracle Pass {{Class|QuestItem19}} // {{Class|QuestItem20}} // {{Class|QuestItem21}} // You killed the Bishop! {{Class|QuestItem22}} // You killed the Oracle after the Bishop {{Class|QuestItem23}} // You killed the Oracle! {{Class|QuestItem24}} // You killed Macil! {{Class|QuestItem25}} // Given when destroying the converter, results in good ending {{Class|QuestItem26}} // You killed the Loremaster! {{Class|QuestItem27}} // You blew up the computer {{Class|QuestItem28}} // Given with the Catacomb Key {{Class|QuestItem29}} // Given when destroying the transmitter {{Class|QuestItem30}} // {{Class|QuestItem31}} // {{Class|DegninOre}} // An explosive item that can be picked up and placed elsewhere {{Class|BeldinsRing}} // Ring from Beldin, the captured Front "traitor" {{Class|OfferingChalice}} // A rather useless item Harris asks you to get for him {{Class|Ear}} // Ear torn from Derwin when accepting Governor Mourel's "bloody" job {{Class|BrokenPowerCoupling}} // An already broken power coupling that is given to the governor. {{Class|InterrogatorReport}} // {{Class|GunTraining}} // {{Class|HealthTraining}} // {{Class|GuardUniform}} // The green uniform dropped by the sewer guard, and is given to the rat king for help. {{Class|OfficersUniform}} // {{Class|Info}} // ===Keys=== {{Class|StrifeKey}} // Strife key template {{Class|BaseKey}} // Key to access Order base, given by Rowan {{Class|GovsKey}} // Key to access Governor mansion, given by Macil {{Class|Passcard}} // Key to access Power Station, given by Macil or Governor {{Class|IDBadge}} // Key to open a door in Prison, dropped by security guard {{Class|PrisonKey}} // Key to Prison locks, dropped by Warden Montag {{Class|SeveredHand}} // Key to opening hand scanner doors, dropped by Judge Wolenick {{Class|Power1Key}} // Key to opening doors in Power Station, given/dropped by Worner {{Class|Power2Key}} // Key to opening doors in Power Station, given/dropped by technician {{Class|Power3Key}} // Key to operating lift in Power Station, given/dropped by Sammis {{Class|GoldKey}} // Key to opening door in Power Station, dropped by storage worker {{Class|IDCard}} // Open armory door in Sewers, dropped by certain sewer guards {{Class|SilverKey}} // Key to opening doors in Castle, dropped by fake programmer in Audience Chamber {{Class|OracleKey}} // Key to opening door to Oracle, dropped by door guards {{Class|MilitaryID}} // Key to opening door into mini base in Borderlands, Oracle pass traded for key {{Class|OrderKey}} // Key to opening storage room in mini base in Borderlands {{Class|WarehouseKey}} // Unused, dev error? Supposed to be given by Quincy(?) to get into Warehouse level in the Bailey {{Class|BrassKey}} // Key to opening door into Order Commons, given by Macil {{Class|RedCrystalKey}} // Key to activate switch in Conversion Chapel, found in same location {{Class|BlueCrystalKey}} // Key to activate switch in Conversion Chapel, found in same location {{Class|ChapelKey}} // Key to activate door in Conversion Chapel, found is same location {{Class|CatacombKey}} // Key used for door trigger(?), given by Richter {{Class|SecurityKey}} // Unused, dev error? Supposed to be given by Quincy to get into the Security Complex level in the Bailey {{Class|CoreKey}} // Key used to activate doors in Security Complex level, found in same location {{Class|MaulerKey}} // Key used to activate doors in Warehouse, dropped by guard {{Class|FactoryKey}} // Key used to access Factory (?), found in Ruined Temple {{Class|MineKey}} // Key used to access Mines level, found in Ruined Temple {{Class|NewKey5}} // Strife development key {{Class|PrisonPass}} // Not supposed to be a key, it's an item used for trade for further entry into Prison {{Class|OraclePass}} // Not supposed to be a key, but has been used as a key, item traded for a key ===Props=== {{Class|Tank1}} {{Class|Tank2}} {{Class|Tank3}} {{Class|Tank4}} {{Class|Tank5}} {{Class|Tank6}} {{Class|LightSilverFluorescent}} {{Class|LightBrownFluorescent}} {{Class|LightGoldFluorescent}} {{Class|LightGlobe}} {{Class|PillarTechno}} {{Class|PillarAztec}} {{Class|PillarAztecDamaged}} {{Class|PillarAztecRuined}} {{Class|PillarHugeTech}} {{Class|PillarAlienPower}} {{Class|SStalactiteBig}} {{Class|SStalactiteSmall}} {{Class|SStalagmiteBig}} {{Class|CavePillarTop}} {{Class|CavePillarBottom}} {{Class|SStalagmiteSmall}} {{Class|Candle}} {{Class|StrifeCandelabra}} {{Class|WaterDropOnFloor}} {{Class|WaterfallSplash}} {{Class|WaterDrip}} {{Class|WaterFountain}} {{Class|HeartsInTank}} {{Class|SRock1}} {{Class|SRock2}} {{Class|SRock3}} {{Class|SRock4}} {{Class|StickInWater}} {{Class|Rubble1}} {{Class|Rubble2}} {{Class|Rubble3}} {{Class|Rubble4}} {{Class|Rubble5}} {{Class|Rubble6}} {{Class|Rubble7}} {{Class|Rubble8}} {{Class|SurgeryCrab}} {{Class|LargeTorch}} {{Class|HugeTorch}} {{Class|PalmTree}} {{Class|BigTree2}} {{Class|PottedTree}} {{Class|TreeStub}} {{Class|ShortBush}} {{Class|TallBush}} {{Class|ChimneyStack}} {{Class|BarricadeColumn}} {{Class|Pot}} {{Class|Pitcher}} {{Class|Stool}} {{Class|MetalPot}} {{Class|Tub}} {{Class|Anvil}} {{Class|TechLampSilver}} {{Class|TechLampBrass}} {{Class|Tray}} {{Class|WaterBottle}} {{Class|Mug}} {{Class|WoodenBarrel}} {{Class|ExplosiveBarrel2}} {{Class|DeadStrifePlayer}} {{Class|DeadPeasant}} {{Class|DeadAcolyte}} {{Class|DeadReaver}} {{Class|DeadRebel}} {{Class|SacrificedGuy}} {{Class|PileOfGuts}} {{Class|StrifeBurningBarrel}} {{Class|BurningBowl}} {{Class|BurningBrazier}} {{Class|SmallTorchLit}} {{Class|SmallTorchUnlit}} {{Class|CeilingChain}} {{Class|CageLight}} {{Class|Statue}} {{Class|StatueRuined}} {{Class|MediumTorch}} {{Class|OutsideLamp}} {{Class|PoleLantern}} {{Class|SigilBanner}} {{Class|RebelBoots}} {{Class|RebelHelmet}} {{Class|RebelShirt}} {{Class|PowerCoupling}} {{Class|AlienBubbleColumn}} {{Class|AlienFloorBubble}} {{Class|AlienCeilingBubble}} {{Class|AlienAspClimber}} {{Class|AlienSpiderLight}} {{Class|DeadCrusader}} {{Class|TargetPractice}} // Shootable, spins when shot {{Class|AmmoFiller}} ==Misc== {{Class|CloseDoor222}} // Closes door with tag 222 when given or picked up {{Class|Computer}} // Computer, shows "You blew up the computer" and gives QuestItem 27 when killed {{Class|Meat}} // Turns into a random gib when spawned {{Class|ForceFieldGuard}} // A dummy item that can only be killed by a Degnin Ore Explosion {{Class|Junk}} // Turns into random junk when spawned {{Class|KlaxonWarningLight}} // Klaxon alarm, no special action except it goes to sleep after a short period {{Class|OpenDoor222}} // Opens door with tag 222 when given or picked up {{Class|OpenDoor224}} // Opens door with tag 224 when given or picked up {{Class|Piston}} // Gates, prints "You've blown up the gates!" and gives QuestItem 16 to all players in the game when killed. {{Class|PowerCrystal}} // Power Crystal, Kills everything less than 512 units away from it, prints "You blew up the Power Crystal!",
// and gives QuestItem 14 when destroyed. Lowers the sector it's in and changes its light to 0. {{Class|RaiseAlarm}} // Emits an imaginary sound when given or picked up, alerting nearby monsters {{Class|TeleportSwirl}} // Hovers over teleporters and looks tacky {{Class|Zombie}} // Looks like a peasant. Stands there, Gibs when killed {{Class|ZombieSpawner}} // Spawns a Zombie every certain amount of time ==Unclassified== {{Class|DummyStrifeItem}} // Strife item template {{Class|SlideshowStarter}} // Strife slideshow template {{Class|StrifePlayer}} // Strife player {{Class|FireDroplet}} // This is spawned by human targets when killed by fire {{Class|StrifeHumanoid}} // Strife base class for Strife human actors {{Class|StrifeWeapon}} // Strife base class for Strife weapons {{Class|Bang4Cloud}} // Grenade explosion, rises when spawned [[category:Actors]]
